fullplot: Dark, biting satire of the television industry, focusing on an Ivy-League educated black writer at a major network. Frustrated that his ideas for a "Cosby Show"-esque take on the black family has been rejected by network brass, he devises an outlandish scheme: reviving the minstrel show. The hook: instead of white actors in black face, the show stars black actors in even blacker face. The show becomes an instant smash, but with the success also comes repercussions for all involved.
plot: A frustrated African American TV writer proposes a blackface minstrel show in protest, but to his chagrin it becomes a hit.
title: Bamboozled

tomatoes.consensus: Bamboozled is too heavy-handed in its satire and comes across as more messy and overwrought than biting.
